title: So what's the point of the PBE if feedback is ignored?
body:
So the 5.2 patch notes are up, and despite the response to the tier 2 jungle item cost increase being negative almost everywhere I looked (these forums, the reddit, surrender@20) there is it in the patch notes.

Everywhere called it out as an unnecessary nerf to the already weak early jungling over a problem with the first blood mechanic, that would have a significant effect on a substantial portion of jungle champs despite Riots claim that the change would only effect "a very specific situation".

I get that sometimes big changes have to be pushed through despite pushback, like the overhaul of masteries or the new jungle, but when a small change has a much larger negative change than it seems like was intended, that seems like exactly what the PBE is for, to find those unexpected consequences and let you rethink or rebalance things, but it seems MORE like you use it as a pre-view system than a beta for testing out experimental changes.

I would tend to disagree.  Our feedback is worthless if literally nothing is being considered.  Why should we even bother?

PBE is largely for testing things to see whether they work properly.

Things like detecting that Riven became broken with the stacking CC changes.

Its not just about feedbacks. Its also about the results they see in the whole healthiness of the game. 
Here is what that item did.

1) Stops jungler from getting 3 camps and buying the tier 2 item.
2) Stops quick opponent junglers from invading your 2nd buff and taking it before you get to it because you recalled after 3 camps. 
3) Stops the quick 3 camp gank with chilling smite specially on junglers with CC like J4

ONLY thing different now is you have to do 1 more camp before you can buy your damn tier 2 item. Not a big deal. 
Its actually pretty good.

Except it IS a big deal. 
1. A lot of weaker early jungle champs and lesser skilled jungle players CAN'T hit that 4th camp, which creates a NEW split of good and bad that the jungle REALLY didn't need as none of the 5.1 strong from the start (and strong all game) junglers are hurt, but lots of full tank and slow to start junglers will be even weaker in 5.2. For example: a Vi will head back into the jungle with tier 2 after first back, Eve will not. J4 will have tier 2, Wukong will not, etc.
2. This change will make hitting your second buff more enticing and the people who were banking on you not going to it for an easy steal can just wait for you to show up with low health trying to get a 4th camp and kill you.
3. The recall after 3 to get the 2nd tier jungle item already delayed level 2 ganks as soon as they hit 2, adding one more camp just makes waiting to level 3 more enticing, nothing else.

But the reason they gave for the change wasn't ANY of those, they said it was because a Jungler can pick up a first blood and back to get the tier 2 right away, which is a problem with the FIRST BLOOD mechanic and NOT with the jungle core item. 400 gold on ANYONE before 2 minutes isn't exactly going to be a good time for their opponent, it's not an exclusive problem to the jungle.

The jungler diversity problem is a serious problem.

Half measures like making it possible for Nautilus to drag himself through 3 camps on no health, needing to back immediately, and getting tier 2 item won't fix the problem.  (Most) Tank junglers need buffs.  That strategic diversity thing RIot says they want needs to actually happen.

The buffs some of the tanky/tank junglers got have been actually quite decent.

Players (notably LCS) Find new problematic ways to exploit the system. 

Riot fix said problem.

People complain about Riot fixing exploit because a hand full of champions are viable, ONLY because they use said exploit.

I'm going to be honest. If Riot finds a Problem, they should fix it. And if champions were viable only because of that exploit. then they are viable for the wrong reasons. Fix the Problem, then look at the problemed champions to figure out how we can make them viable for the Right reasons.

But this change isn't fixing the PROBLEM, it's fixing a symptom and having side effects.

The problem was that first blood was easy to snowball off of if a jungler got it before camps even spawned, so they made the jungle item more expensive for tier 2. But the side effect is that the extra 100 gold means that anyone who has to B after 3 camps (which almost every jungle champ can manage) will be WEAKER than a jungle champ that can hit a 4th jungle (significantly less champs than can make 3) for the SAME REASON that the increase was supposed to fix, that one jungler has the item before the other and therefor has the advantage over the other jungler and earlier chances to viably gank.

A better fix would be to make first blood worth less till 2 minutes, like they already did with assist gold to handle the issue of level 1 team fights providing a substantial advantage to the victor.
